Comments_List: I learned a lot of novel machine learning methods, especially those in dimensionality reduction and neural networks. I also learned about actual applications of these methods to complex biological questions.
Major tools and algorithms in machine learning
I learned a ton. The justification for a variety of machine learning methods and inspirations for ideas to apply them to my own work.

The course offers a great variety of useful machine learning theories and concepts, as well as cutting-edge applications. Assignments are well-designed and helpful to getting familiar with these methods. However, the professor went over some of the contents too fast. It would be better if these could be explained in greater detail.

Writing our own code was very useful but lectures often took too broad brush a view of the information and/or assumed the level of knowledge of the students was higher. I received feed back on only one assignment, so it was difficult to improve some aspects of my work.
I have an overall view of machine learning

The weeks where the course was taught by the instructor were superb. The guest lectures, though, seemed uncoordinated and led to a large redundancy in covered material. This led to me disengaging with the course during those weeks.

This course has an in-depth insights of many machine learning methods and applications. It is good for students who seek to apply machine learning methods  to biological problems but do not have a very strong computational background.

I would recommend this course to students who have a high working knowledge of linear algebra and basic machine learning algorithms already. I would not recommend it to anyone with less knowledge of the subject matter before the course.
Sure, it is really useful for students who are interested in using machine learning method in practical application
Smita is knowledgeable and approachable in a subject that is hard to approach and full of things to know.
